speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: SCENE III. Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Enter COUNTESS, Steward, and Clown

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: I will now hear; what say you of this gentlewoman?

speaker: Steward
text_entry: Madam, the care I have had to even your content, I

speaker: Steward
text_entry: wish might be found in the calendar of my past

speaker: Steward
text_entry: endeavours; for then we wound our modesty and make

speaker: Steward
text_entry: foul the clearness of our deservings, when of

speaker: Steward
text_entry: ourselves we publish them.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: What does this knave here? Get you gone, sirrah:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: the complaints I have heard of you I do not all

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: believe: 'tis my slowness that I do not; for I know

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: you lack not folly to commit them, and have ability

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: enough to make such knaveries yours.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'Tis not unknown to you, madam, I am a poor fellow.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Well, sir.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: No, madam, 'tis not so well that I am poor, though

speaker: Clown
text_entry: many of the rich are damned: but, if I may have

speaker: Clown
text_entry: your ladyship's good will to go to the world, Isbel

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the woman and I will do as we may.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Wilt thou needs be a beggar?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I do beg your good will in this case.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: In what case?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: In Isbel's case and mine own. Service is no

speaker: Clown
text_entry: heritage: and I think I shall never have the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: blessing of God till I have issue o' my body; for

speaker: Clown
text_entry: they say barnes are blessings.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Tell me thy reason why thou wilt marry.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: My poor body, madam, requires it: I am driven on

speaker: Clown
text_entry: by the flesh; and he must needs go that the devil drives.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Is this all your worship's reason?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Faith, madam, I have other holy reasons such as they

speaker: Clown
text_entry: are.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: May the world know them?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I have been, madam, a wicked creature, as you and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: all flesh and blood are; and, indeed, I do marry

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that I may repent.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Thy marriage, sooner than thy wickedness.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I am out o' friends, madam; and I hope to have

speaker: Clown
text_entry: friends for my wife's sake.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Such friends are thine enemies, knave.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: You're shallow, madam, in great friends; for the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: knaves come to do that for me which I am aweary of.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: He that ears my land spares my team and gives me

speaker: Clown
text_entry: leave to in the crop; if I be his cuckold, he's my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: drudge: he that comforts my wife is the cherisher

speaker: Clown
text_entry: of my flesh and blood; he that cherishes my flesh

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and blood loves my flesh and blood; he that loves my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: flesh and blood is my friend: ergo, he that kisses

speaker: Clown
text_entry: my wife is my friend. If men could be contented to

speaker: Clown
text_entry: be what they are, there were no fear in marriage;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: for young Charbon the Puritan and old Poysam the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Papist, howsome'er their hearts are severed in

speaker: Clown
text_entry: religion, their heads are both one; they may jowl

speaker: Clown
text_entry: horns together, like any deer i' the herd.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Wilt thou ever be a foul-mouthed and calumnious knave?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: A prophet I, madam; and I speak the truth the next

speaker: Clown
text_entry: way:

speaker: Clown
text_entry: For I the ballad will repeat,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Which men full true shall find;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Your marriage comes by destiny,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Your cuckoo sings by kind.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Get you gone, sir; I'll talk with you more anon.

speaker: Steward
text_entry: May it please you, madam, that he bid Helen come to

speaker: Steward
text_entry: you: of her I am to speak.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Sirrah, tell my gentlewoman I would speak with her;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Helen, I mean.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Was this fair face the cause, quoth she,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Why the Grecians sacked Troy?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Fond done, done fond,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Was this King Priam's joy?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With that she sighed as she stood,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With that she sighed as she stood,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: And gave this sentence then;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Among nine bad if one be good,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Among nine bad if one be good,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: There's yet one good in ten.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: What, one good in ten? you corrupt the song, sirrah.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: One good woman in ten, madam; which is a purifying

speaker: Clown
text_entry: o' the song: would God would serve the world so all

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the year! we'ld find no fault with the tithe-woman,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: if I were the parson. One in ten, quoth a'! An we

speaker: Clown
text_entry: might have a good woman born but one every blazing

speaker: Clown
text_entry: star, or at an earthquake, 'twould mend the lottery

speaker: Clown
text_entry: well: a man may draw his heart out, ere a' pluck

speaker: Clown
text_entry: one.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: You'll be gone, sir knave, and do as I command you.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: That man should be at woman's command, and yet no

speaker: Clown
text_entry: hurt done! Though honesty be no puritan, yet it

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will do no hurt; it will wear the surplice of

speaker: Clown
text_entry: humility over the black gown of a big heart. I am

speaker: Clown
text_entry: going, forsooth: the business is for Helen to come hither.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Well, now.

speaker: Steward
text_entry: I know, madam, you love your gentlewoman entirely.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Faith, I do: her father bequeathed her to me; and

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: she herself, without other advantage, may lawfully

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: make title to as much love as she finds: there is

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: more owing her than is paid; and more shall be paid

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: her than she'll demand.

speaker: Steward
text_entry: Madam, I was very late more near her than I think

speaker: Steward
text_entry: she wished me: alone she was, and did communicate

speaker: Steward
text_entry: to herself her own words to her own ears; she

speaker: Steward
text_entry: thought, I dare vow for her, they touched not any

speaker: Steward
text_entry: stranger sense. Her matter was, she loved your son:

speaker: Steward
text_entry: Fortune, she said, was no goddess, that had put

speaker: Steward
text_entry: such difference betwixt their two estates; Love no

speaker: Steward
text_entry: god, that would not extend his might, only where

speaker: Steward
text_entry: qualities were level; Dian no queen of virgins, that

speaker: Steward
text_entry: would suffer her poor knight surprised, without

speaker: Steward
text_entry: rescue in the first assault or ransom afterward.

speaker: Steward
text_entry: This she delivered in the most bitter touch of

speaker: Steward
text_entry: sorrow that e'er I heard virgin exclaim in: which I

speaker: Steward
text_entry: held my duty speedily to acquaint you withal;

speaker: Steward
text_entry: sithence, in the loss that may happen, it concerns

speaker: Steward
text_entry: you something to know it.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: You have discharged this honestly; keep it to

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: yourself: many likelihoods informed me of this

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: before, which hung so tottering in the balance that

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: I could neither believe nor misdoubt. Pray you,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: leave me: stall this in your bosom; and I thank you

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: for your honest care: I will speak with you further anon.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Exit Steward

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Enter HELENA

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Even so it was with me when I was young:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: If ever we are nature's, these are ours; this thorn

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Doth to our rose of youth rightly belong;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Our blood to us, this to our blood is born;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: It is the show and seal of nature's truth,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Where love's strong passion is impress'd in youth:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: By our remembrances of days foregone,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Such were our faults, or then we thought them none.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Her eye is sick on't: I observe her now.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What is your pleasure, madam?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: You know, Helen,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: I am a mother to you.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Mine honourable mistress.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Nay, a mother:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Why not a mother? When I said 'a mother,'

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Methought you saw a serpent: what's in 'mother,'

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: That you start at it? I say, I am your mother;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: And put you in the catalogue of those

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: That were enwombed mine: 'tis often seen

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Adoption strives with nature and choice breeds

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: A native slip to us from foreign seeds:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: You ne'er oppress'd me with a mother's groan,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Yet I express to you a mother's care:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: God's mercy, maiden! does it curd thy blood

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: To say I am thy mother? What's the matter,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: That this distemper'd messenger of wet,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: The many-colour'd Iris, rounds thine eye?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Why? that you are my daughter?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That I am not.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: I say, I am your mother.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Pardon, madam;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The Count Rousillon cannot be my brother:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I am from humble, he from honour'd name;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: No note upon my parents, his all noble:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: My master, my dear lord he is; and I

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: His servant live, and will his vassal die:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: He must not be my brother.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Nor I your mother?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: You are my mother, madam; would you were,--

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: So that my lord your son were not my brother,--

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Indeed my mother! or were you both our mothers,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I care no more for than I do for heaven,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: So I were not his sister. Can't no other,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But, I your daughter, he must be my brother?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Yes, Helen, you might be my daughter-in-law:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: God shield you mean it not! daughter and mother

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: So strive upon your pulse. What, pale again?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: My fear hath catch'd your fondness: now I see

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: The mystery of your loneliness, and find

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Your salt tears' head: now to all sense 'tis gross

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: You love my son; invention is ashamed,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Against the proclamation of thy passion,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: To say thou dost not: therefore tell me true;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: But tell me then, 'tis so; for, look thy cheeks

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Confess it, th' one to th' other; and thine eyes

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: See it so grossly shown in thy behaviors

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: That in their kind they speak it: only sin

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: And hellish obstinacy tie thy tongue,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: That truth should be suspected. Speak, is't so?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: If it be so, you have wound a goodly clew;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: If it be not, forswear't: howe'er, I charge thee,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: As heaven shall work in me for thine avail,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Tell me truly.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Good madam, pardon me!

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Do you love my son?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Your pardon, noble mistress!

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Love you my son?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Do not you love him, madam?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Go not about; my love hath in't a bond,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Whereof the world takes note: come, come, disclose

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: The state of your affection; for your passions

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Have to the full appeach'd.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Then, I confess,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Here on my knee, before high heaven and you,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That before you, and next unto high heaven,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I love your son.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: My friends were poor, but honest; so's my love:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Be not offended; for it hurts not him

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That he is loved of me: I follow him not

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: By any token of presumptuous suit;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Nor would I have him till I do deserve him;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Yet never know how that desert should be.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I know I love in vain, strive against hope;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Yet in this captious and intenible sieve

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I still pour in the waters of my love

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And lack not to lose still: thus, Indian-like,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Religious in mine error, I adore

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The sun, that looks upon his worshipper,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But knows of him no more. My dearest madam,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Let not your hate encounter with my love

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: For loving where you do: but if yourself,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Whose aged honour cites a virtuous youth,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Did ever in so true a flame of liking

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Wish chastely and love dearly, that your Dian

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Was both herself and love: O, then, give pity

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To her, whose state is such that cannot choose

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But lend and give where she is sure to lose;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That seeks not to find that her search implies,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But riddle-like lives sweetly where she dies!

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Had you not lately an intent,--speak truly,--

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: To go to Paris?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Madam, I had.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Wherefore? tell true.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I will tell truth; by grace itself I swear.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: You know my father left me some prescriptions

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Of rare and proved effects, such as his reading

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And manifest experience had collected

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: For general sovereignty; and that he will'd me

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: In heedfull'st reservation to bestow them,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: As notes whose faculties inclusive were

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: More than they were in note: amongst the rest,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: There is a remedy, approved, set down,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To cure the desperate languishings whereof

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The king is render'd lost.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: This was your motive

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: For Paris, was it? speak.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: My lord your son made me to think of this;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Else Paris and the medicine and the king

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Had from the conversation of my thoughts

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Haply been absent then.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: But think you, Helen,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: If you should tender your supposed aid,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: He would receive it? he and his physicians

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Are of a mind; he, that they cannot help him,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: They, that they cannot help: how shall they credit

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: A poor unlearned virgin, when the schools,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Embowell'd of their doctrine, have left off

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: The danger to itself?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: There's something in't,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: More than my father's skill, which was the greatest

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Of his profession, that his good receipt

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Shall for my legacy be sanctified

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: By the luckiest stars in heaven: and, would your honour

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But give me leave to try success, I'ld venture

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The well-lost life of mine on his grace's cure

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: By such a day and hour.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Dost thou believe't?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Ay, madam, knowingly.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Why, Helen, thou shalt have my leave and love,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Means and attendants and my loving greetings

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: To those of mine in court: I'll stay at home

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: And pray God's blessing into thy attempt:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Be gone to-morrow; and be sure of this,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: What I can help thee to thou shalt not miss.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Exeunt
